channel.title: Some Suggestions
channel.description:
[quote="The Wanderer, post:1, topic:435081"]I am constantly browsing mopar on my phone and it annoys me that I cannot report posts with the mobile theme. Yes I switch to another theme to report a post, but that would defeat the purpose of having a mobile theme, wouldn't it? So yeah, would be a major plus if you could add that.
And the ability to vote on polls and add support for viewing list bbc.[/quote] Suggested that a while ago and it didn't really get that much attention imo. :(
I also feel that we should get more activity on the wiki. I'm going to document a lot of the packets for 377 and any 317 packets that aren't documented right now, but I noticed that hardly anyone makes some contributions. Maybe if you added a badge for a member who has made a lot of contributions to the wiki, it would give an incentive for other users to contribute more.

item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Well. I am going to keep this open (rather unorthodox, but either way) for now. We may not reply in it anytime soon, but I do want to investigate the idea further once we have the means and time to. item.title: Some Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I wouldn’t want it in the post user signature, I’d probably just want it somewhere in the main profile. I do not support board redirections to the wiki, I think it will cause too much clutter.

As for the mobile theme, that’s something that MITB realizes is an issue and just hasn’t gotten around to (or doesn’t know how to) fix.

item.title: Some Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:7, topic:444415”]This may just be a silly thought, but is it possible to create a field under reputation which shows the number of Wiki contributions a user has? Something like:

Wiki contributions: 2

The link (number) could either link to the wiki’s homepage or else to a list of that users contributions. This is an idea that could increase it’s activity, but at the same time I think it’s a bit far-fetched since it would probably require the forum + wiki to be integrated. Just throwing out ideas. :|[/quote]

It’s possible, but would require another modification and wiki integration (not sure how much/if at all the wiki is integrated). I can somewhat not proudly say I haven’t spent any time on the wiki. I think it’s a fantastic idea, though. And, in order to reduce clutter, it would only show up if the user has > 0 contributions.

Read full topic

item.title: Some Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Taharok:

We need some way to develop pages quickly and thoroughly.

Couldn’t stress that more. Surely there is a plugin or something of the sort for wikis that would like to allow editing of pages through a more graphical way? Even a drag and drop interface would be better than what it is right now.

I can’t think of any more ways to advertise it other than the badge or what you guys have done already (announcements and tab). Only other incentive I could think of would be money, but I highly doubt MITB would want to pay users to create pages for the wiki (I also think that would kind of ruin it, since the wiki is made for people to share information, not make money). Anyone else think of anything?

Read full topic

item.description:

I’m open to redirection boards once we have a fair amount of pages. We need some way to develop pages quickly and thoroughly. It’s kind of a dead heap right now.

item.title: Some Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Making it more user friendly would definitely be a plus. I understand t4 operates the wiki so I may have to pm him about doing this, but it is a pain to add anything.

Maybe have a redirect board as a child to server help section? That would surely get more people looking at and perhaps more people contributing. My only worry with that would be people creating useless pages asking for help, although I’m not sure if it would even be that large of deal.

Read full topic

item.title: Some Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I agree with you on the mobile theme. It does need updating with certain features if it’s possible. For example a few basic moderator actions would be nice, and also the ability to view somebodies profile, it seems that I have to revert to the proper website layout to do this, which is annoying.

@wiki badge, I don’t particularly know if I like this one. While I wouldn’t be against a badge like ‘Top Wiki Contributer’ or something of the likes, a badge for just contributing anything doesn’t appeal to me. Also there’s not really much more we can do to advertise the wiki. We’ve already posted announcements about it and made a tab especially for it. Do you have any ideas?

Read full topic
